description.narrative:
This project is building on the results and lessons learnt of the project "Tax, Budget and Citizen Participation" launched by FTDESand supported by Oxfam which provided associations of 4 regions (Gafsa, Kasserine, Monastir, Siliana) with legal knowledgein the process of regional development as well as theoretical knowledge consolidated by field work on Citizen project audit techniques.
Thisproject #Citizen Audit# will focus on three regions and will implement a monitoring and evaluation approach inthe development projects of participant associations in order to assess their continued justification through monthly meetings and field activities (datacollection, advocacy#). The project aims to create networking opportunities through a regional coordination body dedicated to regional development, enable participant associations to work within a reasonable time frame on development projects in order to create change in their fields of action and to implement project control techniques and citizen audit as common practice within Tunisian associations.

participating-org.narrative: FTDES Forum Tunisien pour les droit Econo

The Tunisian Forum for Economic and Social Rights (FTDES) is a Tunisian organization declared in the Official Gazette in 2011. It was created in 2011 in order to defend the economic and social rights of the population nationally and internationally. The FTDES working on the following themes: labor law, women's rights, environmental rights and rights of migrants. The FTDES is a member of various international networks including FIDH, Migreurop, Loujna Tounkaranké, Boats 4 People. The FTDES HQ is in Tunis and works under the direction of a steering committee. It has several dozen members across Tunisia and more than twenty employees. The FTDES has chapters in the cities of Kairouan, Kasserine, Gafsa and Monastir.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
